project_name: Thalpitigala Reservoir Project
main_components: Provide irrigation water to new and existing lands around 1400 hectares in the area by constructing upstream of the Battmedilla anicut in the Baudlla district.; Provide safe drinking water facilities to Wasanagama, Madulla, Thetilla and Beramada villages in the Kandaketiya Divisional Secretary's Division.; Construct a hydro power station with a capacity of 15 MW that will generate 51 GWh of hydro power annually to feed the National Grid.
implementing_agency: Ministry of Irrigation and Water Resources Management
executing_agency: Ministry of Irrigation and Water Resources Management
Project Name: Thalpitigala Reservoir Project
Main Component/s: Provide irrigation water to new and existing lands around 1400 hectares in the area by constructing upstream of the Battmedilla anicut in the Baudlla district.; Provide safe drinking water facilities to Wasanagama, Madulla, Thetilla and Beramada villages in the Kandaketiya Divisional Secretary's Division.; Construct a hydro power station with a capacity of 15 MW that will generate 51 GWh of hydro power annually to feed the National Grid.
Implementing Agency: Ministry of Irrigation and Water Resources Management
Executing Agency: Ministry of Irrigation and Water Resources Management

project_name: Hambantota Port Development Phase I for Ancillary Works & Supply of Equipment Project
objectives: Project will envisages economic & social benefits as it will generate direct income & direct & indirect employment opportunities in the area which will contribute to reduce regional income disparities & poverty.
main_components: Deepening the harbor basin for additional 1m depth; Dredging for approaching channel; Additional work of oil terminal; breakwater & revetment modification & handling facilities; New administration & services building; change specification of navigational aid & price escalation
Project Name: Hambantota Port Development Phase I for Ancillary Works & Supply of Equipment Project
Objective/s: Project will envisages economic & social benefits as it will generate direct income & direct & indirect employment opportunities in the area which will contribute to reduce regional income disparities & poverty.
Main Component/s: Deepening the harbor basin for additional 1m depth; Dredging for approaching channel; Additional work of oil terminal; breakwater & revetment modification & handling facilities; New administration & services building; change specification of navigational aid & price escalation

project_name: Hambantota Port Development Phase II
objectives: To build a strong supplementary Port to Colombo Port as an international hub and support Sri Lanka to consolidate the status as a container transshipment hub in the Southern Asian Region.
main_components: Construction of 6 numbers of container berths, oil terminal, yard & roads; Deepeninng of entrance channel; Construction of artificial island & handling facilities; Escavating new basin area
Project Name: Hambantota Port Development Phase II
Amount (USD): USD 600 Million (fully utilized), RMB 1000 million (RMB 300 mn, cancelled) USD 51 mn Cancalled
Objective/s: To build a strong supplementary Port to Colombo Port as an international hub and support Sri Lanka to consolidate the status as a container transshipment hub in the Southern Asian Region.
Main Component/s: Construction of 6 numbers of container berths, oil terminal, yard & roads; Deepeninng of entrance channel; Construction of artificial island & handling facilities; Escavating new basin area

objectives: To improve the transport system in the Southern region by providing an efficient rail transport service from Colombo to Kataragama.

project_name: Bunkering Facility & Tank Farm Project
objectives: The project objective is to supply & store marine fuel, aviation fuel & L.P gas & provide bunkering services for the vessels passing by Sri Lanka.
main_components: Constuction of a bulk storage tank farm with a capacity of 82,000 cubic meters with mixing facilities of fuel oil; Connection of pipe lines from tank farm to the oil terminal; Loading & unloading facilities & other service connections.
Project Name: Bunkering Facility & Tank Farm Project
Objective/s: The project objective is to supply & store marine fuel, aviation fuel & L.P gas & provide bunkering services for the vessels passing by Sri Lanka.

project_name: Puttalam Coal Power I & II
objectives: The project aims the national importance to growing electricity demand in the country at a minimum cost to the economy by reducing the high reliance thermal power generation.
main_components: Installation of a 300MW Coal Power Plant; Jetty for coal handling; Transmission line from  Norochcholai to Veyangoda & substation at  Veyangoda; Establish two power plants with a capacity of 300MW; A transmission line from Norochcholai to Anuradhapura; New substations at Chilaw and Anuradhapura; Construct the Expansion of coal handling port facilities and employees’ housing
Project Name: Puttalam Coal Power I & II
Amount (USD): USD 155 Mn, USD 300 Mn, USD 891 Mn
Objective/s: The project aims the national importance to growing electricity demand in the country at a minimum cost to the economy by reducing the high reliance thermal power generation.
Main Component/s: Installation of a 300MW Coal Power Plant; Jetty for coal handling; Transmission line from  Norochcholai to Veyangoda & substation at  Veyangoda; Establish two power plants with a capacity of 300MW; A transmission line from Norochcholai to Anuradhapura; New substations at Chilaw and Anuradhapura; Construct the Expansion of coal handling port facilities and employees’ housing
